title: Sending a package (GLS Interline), create a label
text: Here are the steps to sending a package via GLS, using GLS interline from the DK office in Brøndby. Firstly you need to connect to the Teknik rum PC, which is located in the office. This is the ONLY pc that GLS interline is running on. You cannot use GLS interline on another PC at the same time, as it will mess up the database/logistics from GLS´s side. Find and open GLS interline, note that it is usually open already. When open, first step is to find the recipient 1. Usually you can find the recipient by searching for their company name, but if you are not getting a match, you can try searching for address details. 2. Click find to search by the criteria you have entered. A match will be shown in the list at the bottom. 3. Click a store/location, and then click select/vælg When a delivery recipient has been chosen, you need to type in the weight and amount of boxes being sent in this delivery. If youre just sending a single box, when pressing save "gem", the label will be printed and is ready to be put on the box. If you're sending more than a single box, you need to type in the weight individually in the next window that pops up when pressing save "gem" Simply type in the weight and press ok. Labels will now be printed. Note the weight on the individual label as they need to be put on their respective boxes
description:
Here are the steps to sending a package via GLS, using GLS interline from the DK office in Brøndby. 




Firstly you need to connect to the Teknik rum PC, which is located in the office. This is the ONLY pc that GLS interline is running on. You cannot use GLS interline on another PC at the same time, as it will mess up the database/logistics from GLS´s side.


Find and open GLS interline, note that it is usually open already. 

When open, first step is to find the recipient

1. Usually you can find the recipient by searching for their company name, but if you are not getting a match, you can try searching for address details. 


2. Click find to search by the criteria you have entered. A match will be shown in the list at the bottom. 


3. Click a store/location, and then click select/vælg


When a delivery recipient has been chosen, you need to type in the weight and amount of boxes being sent in this delivery. 


If youre just sending a single box, when pressing save "gem", the label will be printed and is ready to be put on the box.


If you're sending more than a single box, you need to type in the weight individually in the next window that pops up when pressing save "gem"

Simply type in the weight and press ok. Labels will now be printed. Note the weight on the individual label as they need to be put on their respective boxes

title: Printing a return label
text: When sending something that the customer eventually will have to return (such as status scanners), you can create a return label while creating the shipping label. Usually you would then put the return label in the box, so that its ready to be applied when the package is sent back to us. Simply check the shopreturn box, and you will have a return label printed with your shipping label. In case you only need a return label, check the shopreturn-serviece Label
description:
When sending something that the customer eventually will have to return (such as status scanners), you can create a return label while creating the shipping label. Usually you would then put the return label in the box, so that its ready to be applied when the package is sent back to us.



Simply check the shopreturn box, and you will have a return label printed with your shipping label. 


In case you only need a return label, check the shopreturn-serviece Label

title: Save a label as PDF/A4
text: There can be situations where you need a GLS shipping in the form of a PDF. You might need the label in A4 format, or a customer might want to return something suddenly, and they want the label via mail. Firstly, make sure the shopReturn- Service Label is checked. Go to "Stamdata", and then click "Konfiguration af system" In "teknisk opsætning", choose the printer for "Pakkeseddel printer" to be Microsoft XPS document writer. The label we then be saved on to the PC instead, and can then be attached to a mail sent to the customer.
description:
There can be situations where you need a GLS shipping in the form of a PDF. You might need the label in A4 format, or a customer might want to return something suddenly, and they want the label via mail. 


Firstly, make sure the shopReturn- Service Label is checked. 

Go to "Stamdata", and then click "Konfiguration af system"


In "teknisk opsætning", choose the printer for "Pakkeseddel printer" to be Microsoft XPS document writer. 

The label we then be saved on to the PC instead, and can then be attached to a mail sent to the customer.

title: Looking up earlier shipments - GLS
text: In case you want to see what has been sent from office (via GLS), you can look it up in interline by following these steps: Go to "Stamdata" and then click on "Forsendelser" In the next window, you can query for the shipments. Make sure to check "Overført", and the scope of the date. You can also search by the other parameters if you want to be more specific. Click find and you should get a list of all shipments that match your parameters
description:
In case you want to see what has been sent from office (via GLS), you can look it up in interline by following these steps:


Go to "Stamdata" and then click on "Forsendelser"



In the next window, you can query for the shipments. Make sure to check "Overført", and the scope of the date. You can also search by the other parameters if you want to be more specific.


Click find and you should get a list of all shipments that match your parameters

title: Looking up earlier shipments - TNT
text: In case you need to check what has been sent earlier via TNT, you can, by going to the same portal where you book shipments.
description: In case you need to check what has been sent earlier via TNT, you can, by going to the same portal where you book shipments.

title: Logging into the "Teknik rum PC"
text: The PC intended for printing labels in the "Teknik rum" has DUO authentication. The current users able to login are: - Peer-André Müller - Jacob Höhn Petersen - Fahim Jan To unlock the PC type in the password: K3retail2024 Duo will then send a push notification to Lasse(as he is the default user.) If you are not Lasse, simply cancel the push notification, choose your phone number in the dropdown menu, and then click to get a new push message. If you are not on the list but would like to be, contact Catalin Dinu, he can add you.

title: TO-DO when shipping orders
text: Before we can ship a product/consumable to a customer, there are some procedures we need to follow, to ensure proper stock control and be certain of invoicing. Everything goes into the Hardware orders sheet. When we ship something that belongs to either primary stock, or the support stock, the order needs to be in the sheet, link This is a shared file, if you need access, DK second line, Sales or Carl Duffill should be able to grant it. Make sure to check this sheet frequently for new orders, optimally an order is shipped within 2 days of it being added to the sheet(this does vary from each specific order, as POS/terminals can take more time to prepare) For new orders/fresh stock: 1. Other than being in the excel sheet, it also needs to have an X3 sales order number before it can be shipped. Check column T in the sheet 2. Whenever you ship a product that is serialized, it is important to write down the serial number in Culomn O. This is critical for invoicing. If by any chance, a product has been shipped, without the serial number being noted, you need to contact the customer and have them provide you the serial number. 3. When a shipment has been picked up by GLS/TNT, make sure the row/order is set as "Shipped" in column W For warranty cases/replacements: 1. The order will be written onto the sheet by Support/Hardware 2. A support ticket should have been made in case of faulty hardware. Make sure to include the Freshdesk case number in column Q - This is important, as we need the reason/context for the replacement. 3. Most likely the hardware we send as replacement isn't part of our new stock(instead its from our support stock, to the left in the basement stockroom). Either way, you should still include the hardware serial number(if the item is serialized), as you would for new hardware, for good measure. 4. Mark the replacement as shipped when it has been picked up by GLS/TNT. Usually we will have the customer send us back the faulty hardware. In this case, remember to print a return label for them and put it in the box with the replacement hardware. For rental devices 1. Regarding the sheet, this is somewhat the same procedure as for new orders, remember to write down serial numbers. 2. If you're shipping a rental scanner, instead of the serial number, simply write the number they have on the box. Rental scanners are not part of our fresh stock. 3. Avoid putting labels directly on the rental device box, as this will wear on the cardboard. Instead wrap the box in the wrapping paper available in the basement stock room. 4. Remember to include a return label for rental devices, as we will need them back. 5. Keep track of what rental hardware is in the hands of customers, as they usually have a set date for returning the rented hardware.
description:
Before we can ship a product/consumable to a customer, there are some procedures we need to follow, to ensure proper stock control and be certain of invoicing.



Everything goes into the Hardware orders sheet.


When we ship something that belongs to either primary stock, or the support stock, the order needs to be in the sheet, link

This is a shared file, if you need access,  DK second line, Sales or Carl Duffill should be able to grant it. 

Make sure to check this sheet frequently for new orders, optimally an order is shipped within 2 days of it being added to the sheet(this does vary from each specific order, as POS/terminals can take more time to prepare)




For new orders/fresh stock:


1. Other than being in the excel sheet, it also needs to have an X3 sales order number before it can be shipped. Check column T in the sheet


2. Whenever you ship a product that is serialized, it is important to write down the serial number in Culomn O. This is critical for invoicing. If by any chance, a product has been shipped, without the serial number being noted, you need to contact the customer and have them provide you the serial number. 


3. When a shipment has been picked up by GLS/TNT, make sure the row/order is set as "Shipped" in column W




For warranty cases/replacements:


1. The order will be written onto the sheet by Support/Hardware


2. A support ticket should have been made in case of faulty hardware. Make sure to include the Freshdesk case number in column Q - This is important, as we need the reason/context for the replacement. 


3. Most likely the hardware we send as replacement isn't part of our new stock(instead its from our support stock, to the left in the basement stockroom). Either way, you should still include the hardware serial number(if the item is serialized), as you would for new hardware, for good measure. 


4. Mark the replacement as shipped when it has been picked up by GLS/TNT. Usually we will have the customer send us back the faulty hardware. In this case, remember to print a return label for them and put it in the box with the replacement hardware. 





For rental devices 


1. Regarding the sheet, this is somewhat the same procedure as for new orders, remember to write down serial numbers. 


2. If you're shipping a rental scanner, instead of the serial number, simply write the number they have on the box. Rental scanners are not part of our fresh stock.


3. Avoid putting labels directly on the rental device box, as this will wear on the cardboard. Instead wrap the box in the wrapping paper available in the basement stock room. 


4. Remember to include a return label for rental devices, as we will need them back.


5. Keep track of what rental hardware is in the hands of customers, as they usually have a set date for returning the rented hardware.

title: TO-DO when receiving stock/hardware
text: Often we receive hardware, it can be from customers, hardware suppliers or from other offices. Receiving new stock items 1. When receiving new stock physically, we also need to make sure that it is put into our digital stock. This is done by Carl Duffill. The task for hardware/support is to note the serial numbers of the received stock and send it to Carl. Occasionally the serial numbers have already been provided on a list by the supplier. There can also be a QR/barcode on the box, check for this. You can scan this instead of writing the serial numbers by hand. Receiving rental devices 1.When we get back rental devices, have a look at the hardware to check if it is still in fine condition. 2. Make a note that the hardware has been returned. Receiving faulty devices(warranty/replacement) 1. When hardware stops working within the warranty period, we will provide a replacement. At the same time we will ask for the faulty hardware back, by providing a return label. 2. When the assumingly faulty hardware has returned to K3, check to see if it is actually faulty. Occasionally a customer does a misstep during the setup of new hardware, and then assume that it is faulty. This is unfortunate, however we can usually place the returned item back into the fresh stock as it remains unused. 3. When you have confirmed that the hardware is faulty, check if it is still within the warranty period provided by the hardware supplier. If it is still within warranty, make an RMA request.
description:
Often we receive hardware, it can be from customers, hardware suppliers or from other offices.



Receiving new stock items

1. When receiving new stock physically, we also need to make sure that it is put into our digital stock. This is done by Carl Duffill. The task for hardware/support is to note the serial numbers of the received stock and send it to Carl. Occasionally the serial numbers have already been provided on a list by the supplier. There can also be a QR/barcode on the box, check for this. You can scan this instead of writing the serial numbers by hand.




Receiving rental devices


1.When we get back rental devices, have a look at the hardware to check if it is still in fine condition.


2. Make a note that the hardware has been returned. 




Receiving faulty devices(warranty/replacement)


1. When hardware stops working within the warranty period, we will provide a replacement. At the same time we will ask for the faulty hardware back, by providing a return label.


2. When the assumingly faulty hardware has returned to K3, check to see if it is actually faulty. Occasionally a customer does a misstep during the setup of new hardware, and then assume that it is faulty. This is unfortunate, however we can usually place the returned item back into the fresh stock as it remains unused. 


3. When you have confirmed that the hardware is faulty, check if it is still within the warranty period provided by the hardware supplier. If it is still within warranty, make an RMA request.

title: When shipping outside of EU
text: When shipping outside of EU, you will need to attach an invoice to your shipment. Usually TNT is easiest to use for outside of EU shipments, as you can easily upload the toll invoice during the ordering of pickup. Attached is a blank invoice for reference.
description:
When shipping outside of EU, you will need to attach an invoice to your shipment. Usually TNT is easiest to use for outside of EU shipments, as you can easily upload the toll invoice during the ordering of pickup. 


Attached is a blank invoice for reference.

title: Sending a Package TNT
text: Go to: https://mytnt.tnt.com/?locale=da_DK#/create-shipment Follow the formula, make sure you have dimensions and weight correct. Even if they weight is a bit off, they should correct the shipping price and still ship it. However it might be a good idea to let them know if you know beforehand something needs correcting. In case you need to ship outside of EU, Follow this guide: https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/103000326254?lang=en In case you need to ship to the faroe islands, you will have to arrange a price with TNT. Therefore it might be easier to choose GLS for shipment to the faroe islands, as they have fixed prices. Remember to email GLS (spedition@gls-denmark.com) the toll declaration/toldfaktura and let them have the context, wait for them to get back to you before shipping, as you need a confirmation
description:
Go to:


https://mytnt.tnt.com/?locale=da_DK#/create-shipment


Follow the formula, make sure you have dimensions and weight correct. Even if they weight is a bit off, they should correct the shipping price and still ship it. However it might be a good idea to let them know if you know beforehand something needs correcting.



In case you need to ship outside of EU, Follow this guide: https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/solutions/articles/103000326254?lang=en


In case you need to ship to the faroe islands, you will have to arrange a price with TNT. Therefore it might be easier to choose GLS for shipment to the faroe islands, as they have fixed prices. 


Remember to email GLS (spedition@gls-denmark.com) the toll declaration/toldfaktura and let them have the context, wait for them to get back to you before shipping, as you need a confirmation
